Getting E2's forms to validate

Click Here to validate Nothing Found, a simple superdoc

E2 currently does not validate; at line 55, column 127 (opening tag for the search form), it spits out Error: required attribute "ACTION" not specified . To fix this, we need to add an ACTION (a target uri) to the <form> tag. This section tests whether we can simply move the node_id and lastnode_id into a hidden field in [{[openform]}]. So here I link to my homenode in four ways, only the first of which is available to most noders (non-[gods], non-[edev]):

As an E2 link:

[yerricde]

As an external link:

yerricde

As a get form:

Jump to node ID: Last node ID:

As a post form:

Jump to node ID: Last node ID:

The HTML code for a proper "post" form

<!-- the new openform should output code similar to this -->
<form method="post" action="/index.pl">
<input type="hidden" name="node_id" value="550048" />
<input type="hidden" name="lastnode_id" value="0" />

<!-- and then the body, and then closeform should put up the 'sexisgood'
     end of form marker and the -->
</form>

Getting the rest of E2 to validate

Proprietary HTML

If you're going to be using W3C's HTML [DTD], you should cut down on the [proprietary HTML tags]; if you really like your <[blink]> tag, please use a DTD provided by Netscape. For example, <iframe> is standard and <ilayer> isn't. [CSS] margins are standard; <body topmargin="..."> isn't. Neither are many (redundant?) presentational tags used in E2's markup such as <td border="0"> on line 56.

"What about Netscape 4 users?" Before you get rush out to call the waaambulance, we can still make some themes designed for Netscape 4.x that use bad HTML, and some themes for IE, Mozilla, Konqueror, and Opera based around [CSS]. I'd just like to see an E2 page validate for once.

Invalid entity &lastnode_id;

The SGML parser gives this because a link

<a href="http://everything2.com/index.pl?node_id=124&lastnode_id=0"> ...</a>
should really be
<a href="http://everything2.com/index.pl?node_id=124&lastnode_id=0"> ...</a>
Kuro5hin's [Scoop] engine used to use another workaround, namely fixing the Everything engine to allow ';' in CGI GET requests in addition to '&' like this:
<a href="http://everything2.com/index.pl?node_id=124;lastnode_id=0"> ...</a>
Or use Scoop's current workaround, analogous to the following:
<a href="http://everything2.com/node/124/0/"> ...</a>

Starting forms in the wrong place

From line 55:
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"><tr valign="middle"><form ...

If you want to use tables with forms, don't open the form right inside a table or right inside a row. open it either outside the entire table or inside a cell.
